channel.title: My server npcs don't drop anything atall
channel.description:
Right, Hey guys I downloaded a source and a client but the thing is that the owner of this source and client never coded in Npcdrops and i am very new to coding I have a little bit of experience now but i just can't seem to find a solution to fixing, What it is when i kill a monster they drop nothing not even bones but i have changed the Npcdrops, Spawn-Config and Npcconstants but nothing seems to work if you think maybe you could help me, Please leave a comment below.
Source & client = Explicity

item.title: My server npcs don't drop anything atall
item.dc:creator: @LearningToCode1 LearningToCode1
item.description:
@LearningToCode1 wrote:

[quote=“AddictivePkz, post:8, topic:446090”][quote author=dawwn link=topic=548949.msg4024121#msg4024121 date=1340221004]
Switching to a Pi would be difficult to understand…
[/quote]

LMFAO PI is like the easiest thing ever… especially insidiaX that what i been using when i started coding
Btw i dont know what that source is but in PI check data-cfg-npcdrops.tsm then just add something like this with the npc name and its code

#Mithril_dragon
5363:30 555:100 560:100 565:100 4675:1 4675:1 4675:1 995:5000 995:5000 536:1 563:100 564:100 566:100
13899:1 995:100 557:100 995:1000 13893:1 13887:1 554:100 556:100 557:100 558:100 14479:1 561:100 562:100 11732:1 6585:1 555:100 560:100[/quote]It’s all already done like that…

#Man drops 1:1 995:100 554:100 #Guard drops 9:1 995:200 555:100

Read full topic

item.description:
@AddictivePkz wrote:

dawwn:

Switching to a Pi would be difficult to understand…

LMFAO PI is like the easiest thing ever… especially insidiaX that what i been using when i started coding
Btw i dont know what that source is but in PI check data-cfg-npcdrops.tsm then just add something like this with the npc name and its code

#Mithril_dragon
5363:30 555:100 560:100 565:100 4675:1 4675:1 4675:1 995:5000 995:5000 536:1 563:100 564:100 566:100
13899:1 995:100 557:100 995:1000 13893:1 13887:1 554:100 556:100 557:100 558:100 14479:1 561:100 562:100 11732:1 6585:1 555:100 560:100

item.description:
@LearningToCode1 wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:6, topic:446090”]Instead of learning programming through RSPS, I suggest you learn java through the use of e-books and such, otherwise you won’t get anywhere fast.[/quote]Look i’m just seeing wether anyone can help me or has any suggestion’s if your going to tell me what to do, Just don’t comment at all

item.title: My server npcs don't drop anything atall
item.dc:creator: @LearningToCode1 LearningToCode1
item.description:
@LearningToCode1 wrote:

[quote=“k1ng0frs, post:4, topic:446090”]check your npcdrops.cfg[/quote]I deleted what was inside the npcdrops.cfg file and started again with this code

[code=abap]NPC_ID : DROP_% ITEM_ID : AMOUNT ITEM_ID : AMOUNT ITEM_ID : AMOUNT
//

2026:100 4716:1 4718:1 4720:1 4722:1
[ENDOFNPCDROPLIST][/code]

Read full topic

item.title: My server npcs don't drop anything atall

item.description:
@LearningToCode1 wrote:

[quote=“dawwn, post:2, topic:446090”]If you’re new to coding, switch sources. I know you wont want to, but switch to a delta to learn anything. Switching to a 508+ or Pi would be difficult to understand…[/quote]I do understand it alright but the person who realsed this never coded in drops and i can’t seem to figure it out… I’ve checked the npchandler and everything i just can’t see the problem
